name: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim (1 BLK/Disneyland)

reviews.text: 1. Room
reviews.title: Great location for price
Nice, Adequate Hotel
reviews.text: We loved it!

reviews.title: Great hotel !!!!
reviews.text: Many of the reviews only talk about the standard rooms. We stayed one night in the two bedroom suite for only $200/nite with taxes. Because we split that with another family, it was cheap for us.
The suite had two separate bedrooms with a living room in the middle. That was great because my baby could sleep in one room and the rest could chit chat all nite in the living room.
reviews.title: It's a Hidden Jewel

reviews.text: Lucky for us and my baby, the room looked over the swimming pool. The building we were in only had 4 suites so it was very quiet. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to enjoy the jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom :(
reviews.title: Best Location for the money and Very Nice

reviews.text: I absolutely loved this hotel. We stayed here from the 23/09 - 26/09 and were not dissappointed. Our room was on the 3rd floor in the main building and our view was nothing spectacular. But who goes to a hotel and stares out the window the whole time. This was our first time in America and we found the front desk were extremely helpful with any of our needs. Very convenient having a small shop inside the hotel. We found that walking to Downtown Disney was a good option for meals as it was only a 10-15 minute walk down the street. Downtown Disney also has access to the actual park. Quite a few times we actually walked to Disneyland instead of catching the ART bus. But the ART buses were also a good way to see more of Anaheim as they had to go to other places before they dropped you off at DIsneyland. The restaurant was nice, but as a lot of people say the meals are huge. But good value for your money. And just down the road, about a minute walk is a shop, which is handy for snacks. Overall this hotel was excellent. A great way to start off our trip in the US. We would come back again and again.
reviews.title: wooo loved it

reviews.text: I had booked this hotel thinking that I would receive the same quality that I have experienced at other Holiday Inn's. I was very dissapointed.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not a major clean freak, but the room was noticeably dirty. There were large black smudges all over the curtains, stains on the carpet and grimy black smuges on the bathroom floor. I wiped the room down with clorox wipes, but still never felt comfortable handling anything.
reviews.title: Great for Disneyland Access

reviews.text: The staff was quite nice and pleasant to work with. ART was directly outside the front door and ran promptly every 20 minutes. It was a 10 minute ride to Disneyland with 3 stops prior to the park. Coming back from the park, the hotel is the first stop.
reviews.title: Dated, bad service ... stay away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not stay at this hotel again. There are cleaner hotels closer to the park for around the same price that also include breakfast.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.liked: — the location and size of rooms
likes.disliked: — lack of eating options in the vicinity of hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week. I had read some reviews that made me nervous about staying here. However our experience was very good.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: The check-in was easy and efficient.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - long walk to anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 6th floor. We had a bedroom with 2 double beds (for a family of 4) and a lounge with sofa, chairs, desk, tv. It also had a kitchenette with a microwave, sink and coffee maker. It was very spacious.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel & staff

likes.disliked: — Pre-pay for a 15 dollar discount a night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly. The pool looked good but we didn't use it.
reviews.title: This will be my Anaheim vacation hotel from now on.
A Disappointment
reviews.text: The restaurant wasn't fancy but certainly nice enough. Kids eating free was a big plus for us as our 2 are small eaters and usually end up leaving food on their plates. We ate breakfast there most mornings and dinner a couple of times.

Had a great stay here, very nice staff, room was clean if a little outdated in decor. The staff were able to give us good information (a great help as it was our first time in the US) The walk to Disneyland is about 15 minutes if you cut across the carpark on Walnut street. I notice some reviews mention it is a long walk and it is if you go the wrong way as we did on the first day! We did not eat at the hotel so we can't comment on the food, there are plenty of places to eat around the Disney resort.
reviews.title: Great for price good staff
Great, but what does Advance Purchase really mean?
reviews.text: My husband and I often travel with my best girlfriend, and this was no exception. Since we are all larger people, and since my husband and I have bad knees, we prefer a king bed, and were happy to find that this hotel had King Suites, a king bed with a queen sofa sleeper. Going through the Holiday Inn website, I found that a King Suite would only be $530 (room and tax) for 4 nights Advance Purchase (non-refundable), only $156 more than a Standard 2-Queen room. Our friend would pay the difference, so SOLD! A month later, we arrive, only to find that the only suite available was a Queen Handicapped, which meant that my husband and I spent the next four nights fighting for space (you should SEE my bruises - the 3 incher on my knee is a real beauty!). AND, the bathroom was a nightmare - the bathtub had a seat that could be lifted but not kept out of the way, making the tub half normal length, it had no spigot, and the hand shower (which should have been both a handheld and a fixed-slidable showerhead, but the showerhead part was missing and the slide broken) worked intermittantly at best. There was also no counter space (the bathroom was huge, but it's all open space to accommodate a wheelchair), which made it interesting for 3 adults to share. The final insult was the elevators - our building (the only one with suites) has 2 elevators. One of them was under reconstruction (wires hanging out of the call button plate), and the other did a bungy-cord dance on reaching our floor (6), which traumatized our travel companion who has a phobia about elevators anyway. When management was confronted about the problems, they did offer to knock off what worked out to $39 from the bill, but frankly I felt that it should have been the difference between a suite and a standard room - after all, we only got 2 queens and had to work around an extremely inconvenient bathroom and a wonky elevator.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Overall, I will stay again if the price is right, but I won't trust that Advance Purchase (where they have my money even if I don't show up) will get me the actual room I've purchased.

One other thing - we're annual passholders, so we drive over and park in the garage at Disneyland. It was a source of some giggling every day that we would cruise around the block and park on the other side of the parking lot wall from our suite - were the wall not there, we'd have been able to walk straight into the parking garage and save ourselves about 15 minutes a day!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay for a Reasonable price

reviews.text: This was our first 3 nights on a tour of the USA, the hotel is great, lovely big rooms, restaurant was very nice too, had breakfast there, reasonable prices. This hotel is near Disney! It is only a ten minute stroll - I think that American people like to drive everywhere and if it is more than 100 yards its a long walk. We walked to Disney both days! would recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Loved it!

aka: Holiday Inn Hotel And Suites Anaheim (1 Blk/Disneyland)
description: Our newly renovated property presents guests with a fun and modern art deco ambiance suitable for both business travelers and families alike. This amenities-rich, full-service hotel offers spacious guestrooms and suites at an affordable rate right in the heart of Orange County, adjacent to Disneyland®, Disney’s California Adventure®, Downtown Disney®, and with easy access to the Anaheim Convention Center, and many other Southern California attractions. Now welcoming small dogs!! A fee does apply. Make us your home away from home for your Rose Bowl or BCS Championship game vacation!!
